intro: Ceropegia bentii, commonly known as the African violet or velvet leaf. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which are pollinated by specific insects. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to bright indirect light. Ceropegia bentii is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
